channel.title: Getting your computer back to working state
channel.description:
Well my computer was all crappy cause for a long time i didnt keep up with cleaning spyware and viruses and all that and i found a awsome site that helped me out... If your computer seems slow and freezes up alot i suggest you do the following..
1. goto http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/forums/index.php 2. register there. 3. goto http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/forums/topic34773.html 4. read the instructions and they will help you from there.
- Thrice

item.title: Getting your computer back to working state
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:4, topic:3262”]Hey ipl0x, I didn’t know you posted here.

On topic:
Thanks for the guide, however, most people already knew this. You should also state that going to Start > Run > Type “msconfig” > Ok > Startup and unchecking some programs will increase startup time.[/quote]

rofl, I’ve been busy, didn’t have much time to do anything.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting your computer back to working state

item.title: Getting your computer back to working state
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Hey ipl0x, I didn’t know you posted here.

On topic:
Thanks for the guide, however, most people already knew this. You should also state that going to Start > Run > Type “msconfig” > Ok > Startup and unchecking some programs will increase startup time.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting your computer back to working state

item.title: Getting your computer back to working state
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“Thrice, post:1, topic:3262”]Well my computer was all crappy cause for a long time i didnt keep up with cleaning spyware and viruses and all that and i found a awsome site that helped me out… If your computer seems slow and freezes up alot i suggest you do the following…

  1. goto http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/forums/index.php
  2. register there.
  3. goto http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/forums/topic34773.html
  4. read the instructions and they will help you from there.
  • Thrice[/quote]

I’d like to know what problems you talking about besides the basic freezing and lag. Are you talking about freezing while playing games cause that’s a normal type of thing, then theres the lag from overloaded cpu usage and also too many downloading processes running at the same time. Just tellin.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting your computer back to working state
